intro: Pseudocayratia pengiana, commonly known as the Peng Island false cayratia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within forest understories. Its botanical features include elliptical leaves with serrated edges and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
